channel.title: Unbannable?
channel.description: hello c: i'm relativly new to java coding and i was wondering if somebody could explain (and possibly give me an example of) an if statement that would make someone unbannable by username.

item.title: Unbannable?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

		String[] unbannable = { "Name1", "Name2" };
			for (String i : unbannable) {
				if (playerToBan.equalsIgnoreCase(i)) {
				c.sendMessage("You cannot ban this player");
				return;
						}
				}

Something like this for multiple players

Read full topic

item.title: Unbannable?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

osius:

I appreciate the fact that you replied, but as i said earlier im relativly “new” so, with that in mind, would you care to dumb it down so i can understand what you’re saying? or at least give an example that i cant try to work off of?

Well. We can’t ‘show’ you exactly how to do it, if we don’t know what revision/source you are using.

Read full topic

item.title: Unbannable?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

if(otherString.equalsIgnoreCase("ban") {
    ... ban preparation (username, etc) ...

    if(username.equalsIgnoreCase("username here"))
        return;

    ... continue banning here
}

That’s just a general idea, and there are multiple ways to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Unbannable?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“osius, post:1, topic:481516”]hello c:
i’m relativly new to java coding and i was wondering if somebody could explain (and possibly give me an example of) an if statement that would make someone unbannable by username.[/quote]
You’d just add an exception to any/all of your ban commands.

Read full topic
